title: How to ask people to leave comments on my blog - Quora

response.answer_text: Don't be afraid to be direct and transparent. Just ask people to leave a comment on your blog. However, it would be helpful to ask a specific question that they would be interested in answering. For example, if you have written an article on how coronavirus affected your life, ask people to share their experience of how this situation affected their life.

How can I ask people to leave comments on my blog? Nik Nak’s Old Peculiar I have to say, after some twelve years of blogging? I don’t know that I could honestly tell you for sure. I do know that my most commented on posts are my Daily Teasers: a set of brain teaser quizzes themed around that day in history. I’ve quite a few people happy to leave comments: which I moderate in the morning. My regulars? Like exercising their minds … and like coming back the next day, to see how they’ve done.

The best way is to end your blog post with a question. Be direct and ask a question and then follow it up with "leave your answer in the comment section below." Also, people don't like to the be the first. If you can ask a friend to leave a comment first, it may get the conversation going.

Generally, people avoid leaving comments unless there is something in it for them. Try loading a the CommentLuv plugin if you are running WordPress as this gives an extra link to the commenter. If you are happy with the plugin then search for 'CommnetLuv' lists in Google and ask to be put on them.

I have been blogging for almost 5 years, but it wasn’t until about a year ago that I truly saw the power of commenting. As soon as I started commenting on different blogs, I noticed the traffic to my site increased. By utilizing the commentluv plugin on those blogs, I also notice traffic from the commentluv links. Usually posts that provide a list of items, I will usually mention a few items that I thought were the most important aspect of the topic. Or I like to add my own item to the list ;).
